task.Question: What is the first name of the only Malko Competition recipient from the 20th Century (after 1977) whose nationality on record is a country that no longer exists?

Annotator Metadata.Steps:
1. Look at the Malko Competition page on Wikipedia
2. Scan the winners to see that the 1983 winner, Claus Peter Flor is stated to be from East Germany.

steps.content: What is the first name of the only Malko Competition recipient from the 20th Century (after 1977) whose nationality on record is a country that no longer exists?

plan: Identify the Malko Competition and its recipients, focusing on those awarded after 1977.
Compile a list of recipients from the 20th Century (1978-1999).
Research the nationalities of these recipients to find any that correspond to countries that no longer exist.
Determine which of these recipients is the only one fitting the criteria of being from a non-existent country.
Extract the first name of the identified recipient.

given_facts: The Malko Competition is a music competition.
The competition has recipients from the 20th Century.
The timeframe of interest is after 1977.
The recipient's nationality is a country that no longer exists.
facts_to_lookup: List of Malko Competition recipients after 1977.
List of countries that no longer exist as of the 20th Century.
facts_to_derive: Identify the only recipient from the 20th Century whose nationality corresponds to a non-existent country.

serp.title: All Winners
serp.content: All Winners · Samuel Seungwon Lee · Dmitry Matvienko · Ryan Bancroft · Tung-Chieh Chuang · Rafael Payare · Joshua Weilerstein · Mei-Ann Chen · Seikyo Kim.

serp.title: Malko Competition
serp.content: Recipients ; 2015, Tung-Chieh Chuang, b. 1982 ; 2018, Ryan Bancroft, b. 1989 ; 2021, Dmitry Matvienko, b. 1990 ; 2024, Samuel Seungwon Lee, b. 1990 ...

serp.title: Prize Winners of the past Competitions | Tokyo ...
serp.content: Kazufumi Yamashita won the first prize at the Nicolai Malko Competition for Young Conductors in 1986. He served as the assistant to Maestro Herbert von Karajan ...

serp.title: The Malko Competition 2024 | Malko Competition
serp.content: Samuel Seungwon Lee. South Korea – First prize ; Ana Maria Patiño-Osorio. Colombia – Second prize, Audience Prize, Youth Jury Prize ; Dong Chao. China – Third ...

serp.content: What is the first name of the only Malko Competition recipient from the 20th Century (after 1977) whose nationality on record is a country that no longer exists ...

steps.fact_description: List of Malko Competition recipients after 1977

steps.text:
Title: Malko Competition - Wikipedia
=======================
# Malko Competition

International competition for young conductorsThe **Malko Competition** is an international competition for young [conductors](/wiki/Conducting "Conducting"). It is held every three years by the [Danish Radio Symphony Orchestra](/wiki/Danish_Radio_Symphony_Orchestra "Danish Radio Symphony Orchestra"), to commemorate its founding conductor, [Nicolai Malko](/wiki/Nicolai_Malko "Nicolai Malko").[[1]](#cite_note-1)

Recipients
----------

[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Malko_Competition&action=edit&section=1 "Edit section: Recipients")]

| Year | Recipient | Lifetime | Nationality | Notes |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 1965 | [Ralf Weikert](/wiki/Ralf_Weikert "Ralf Weikert") | b. 1940 | [Austria](/wiki/Austria "Austria") |  |
| 1968 | [Avi Ostrowsky](/wiki/Avi_Ostrowsky "Avi Ostrowsky") | b. 1939 | [Israel](/wiki/Israel "Israel") |  |
| 1971 | [Winston Dan Vogel](/wiki/Winston_Dan_Vogel "Winston Dan Vogel") | b. 1943 | [United States](/wiki/United_States "United States") |  |
| 1974 | [Gotthard Lienicke](/w/index.php?title=Gotthard_Lienicke&action=edit&redlink=1 "Gotthard Lienicke (page does not exist)") |  |  |  |
| 1977 | [Philip Barry Greenberg](/w/index.php?title=Philip_Barry_Greenberg&action=edit&redlink=1 "Philip Barry Greenberg (page does not exist)") |  | [United States](/wiki/United_States "United States") | [[2]](#cite_note-2) |
| 1980 | [Maximiano Valdés](/wiki/Maximiano_Vald%C3%A9s "Maximiano Valdés") | b. 1949 | [Chile](/wiki/Chile "Chile") | [[3]](#cite_note-3) |
| 1983 | [Claus Peter Flor](/wiki/Claus_Peter_Flor "Claus Peter Flor") | b. 1953 | [East Germany](/wiki/East_Germany "East Germany") |  |
| 1986 | [Kazufumi Yamashita](/w/index.php?title=Kazufumi_Yamashita&action=edit&redlink=1 "Kazufumi Yamashita (page does not exist)") | b. 1961 | [Japan](/wiki/Japan "Japan") | [[4]](#cite_note-4) |
| 1989 | [Fabio Mechetti](/wiki/Fabio_Mechetti "Fabio Mechetti") | b. 1957 | [Brazil](/wiki/Brazil "Brazil") | [[5]](#cite_note-5) |
| 1992 | [Jin Wang](/w/index.php?title=Jin_Wang_(conductor)&action=edit&redlink=1 "Jin Wang (conductor) (page does not exist)") | b. 1960 | [Austria](/wiki/Austria "Austria") |  |
| 1995 | [Jan Wagner](/w/index.php?title=Jan_Wagner_(conductor)&action=edit&redlink=1 "Jan Wagner (conductor) (page does not exist)") |  | [Venezuela](/wiki/Venezuela "Venezuela") | [[6]](#cite_note-6) |
| 1998 | [Seikyo Kim](/w/index.php?title=Seikyo_Kim&action=edit&redlink=1 "Seikyo Kim (page does not exist)") | b. 1970 | [Japan](/wiki/Japan "Japan") | [[7]](#cite_note-7) |
| 2001 | [Josep Caballé Domenech](/wiki/Josep_Caball%C3%A9_Domenech "Josep Caballé Domenech")[[note 1]](#cite_note-8) | b. 1973 | [Spain](/wiki/Spain "Spain") |  |
| 2005 | [Mei-Ann Chen](/wiki/Mei-Ann_Chen "Mei-Ann Chen") | b. 1973 | [United States](/wiki/United_States "United States") | [[8]](#cite_note-9) |
| 2009 | [Joshua Weilerstein](/wiki/Joshua_Weilerstein "Joshua Weilerstein") | b. 1987 | [United States](/wiki/United_States "United States") | [[9]](#cite_note-10) |
| 2012 | [Rafael Payare](/wiki/Rafael_Payare "Rafael Payare") | b. 1980 | [Venezuela](/wiki/Venezuela "Venezuela") | [[10]](#cite_note-11) |
| 2015 | [Tung-Chieh Chuang](/w/index.php?title=Tung-Chieh_Chuang&action=edit&redlink=1 "Tung-Chieh Chuang (page does not exist)") | b. 1982 | [Taiwan](/wiki/Taiwan "Taiwan") | [[11]](#cite_note-12) |
| 2018 | [Ryan Bancroft](/wiki/Ryan_Bancroft "Ryan Bancroft") | b. 1989 | [United States](/wiki/United_States "United States") | [[12]](#cite_note-13) |
| 2021 | [Dmitry Matvienko](/w/index.php?title=Dmitry_Matvienko_(conductor)&action=edit&redlink=1 "Dmitry Matvienko (conductor) (page does not exist)") | b. 1990 | [Belarus](/wiki/Belarus "Belarus") | [[13]](#cite_note-14) |
| 2024 | Samuel Seungwon Lee | b. 1990 | South Korea |  |

Notes
-----

[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Malko_Competition&action=edit&section=2 "Edit section: Notes")]

1. **[^](#cite_ref-8)** No first prize was awarded in 2001, and Caballé-Domenech was appointed the highest (2nd) prize.

References
----------

[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Malko_Competition&action=edit&section=3 "Edit section: References")]

1. **[^](#cite_ref-1)** ["Denmark's top orchestra plays"](https://www.newspapers.com/image/857915887/). *[Columbus Ledger-Enquirer](/wiki/Columbus_Ledger-Enquirer "Columbus Ledger-Enquirer")*. Vol. 165, no. 313 (Final ed.). April 9, 1993. p. B-1.
2. **[^](#cite_ref-2)**  Written at [Copenhagen](/wiki/Copenhagen "Copenhagen"). ["Award to Greenberg"](https://www.newspapers.com/image/98892785/). *[Detroit Free Press](/wiki/Detroit_Free_Press "Detroit Free Press")*. Vol. 147, no. 12 (metro ed.). [Detroit](/wiki/Detroit "Detroit"). [Associated Press](/wiki/Associated_Press "Associated Press"). May 16, 1977. p. 16-B.
3. **[^](#cite_ref-3)**  Written at [Copenhagen](/wiki/Copenhagen "Copenhagen"). ["Chilean named top conductor"](https://www.newspapers.com/image/349883195/). *[The Montana Standard](/wiki/The_Montana_Standard "The Montana Standard")*. Vol. 104, no. 356. [Butte, Montana](/wiki/Butte,_Montana "Butte, Montana"). [Associated Press](/wiki/Associated_Press "Associated Press"). May 21, 1980. p. 2.
4. **[^](#cite_ref-4)** ["Japanese Maestro Top Prize Winner"](https://www.latimes.com/archives/la-xpm-1986-07-01-ca-843-story.html). *[Los Angeles Times](/wiki/Los_Angeles_Times "Los Angeles Times")*. July 1, 1986. Retrieved August 9, 2012.
5. **[^](#cite_ref-5)** MacMillan, Kyle (February 3, 1994). ["Brazilian Is Faithful to Composers"](https://www.newspapers.com/image/891334962/). *[Omaha World-Herald](/wiki/Omaha_World-Herald "Omaha World-Herald")*. Vol. 129. pp. 31–32.
6. **[^](#cite_ref-6)** ["Hot conductor"](https://www.newspapers.com/image/639618099/). the ticket. *[The Miami Herald](/wiki/The_Miami_Herald "The Miami Herald")*. Vol. 85, no. 288 (Palm Beach ed.). September 14, 1995. p. 7E.
7. **[^](#cite_ref-7)** ["ARTS & ENTERTAINMENT IN BRIEF 21/7"](https://web.archive.org/web/20100925135423/http://www.lookatvietnam.com/2010/07/arts-entertainment-in-brief-217.html). *Look at Vietnam*. July 21, 2010. Archived from [the original](http://www.lookatvietnam.com/2010/07/arts-entertainment-in-brief-217.html) on September 25, 2010. Retrieved August 9, 2012.
8. **[^](#cite_ref-9)** Johnson, Lawrence A. (4 August 2010). ["Mei-Ann Chen named music director of the Chicago Sinfonietta"](http://chicagoclassicalreview.com/2010/08/mei-ann-chen-named-music-director-of-the-chicago-sinfonietta/). *Chicago Classical Review*. Chicago. Retrieved 17 December 2017.
9. **[^](#cite_ref-10)** Eriksen, Jon Bonde (1 May 2015). ["Former winner: Malko was the start of my conducting career"](https://www.dr.dk/Temaer/Malko/English/Articles/2015/0501110524.htm). *dr.dk*. Retrieved 17 December 2017.
10. **[^](#cite_ref-11)** Mellor, Andrew (14 May 2012). ["Venezuelan Rafael Payare wins Malko Competition"](http://www.gramophone.co.uk/classical-music-news/venezuelan-rafael-payare-wins-malko-competition). *Gramophone*. Haymarket Media Group. Retrieved 9 August 2012.
11. **[^](#cite_ref-12)** ["Tung-Chieh Chuang er vinder af Malko Konkurrencen 2015"](https://www.dr.dk/presse/tung-chieh-chuang-er-vinder-af-malko-konkurrencen-2015). *DR* (in Danish). 1 May 2015.
12. **[^](#cite_ref-13)** ["28-årige Ryan tager 1. plads i stor dansk musikkonkurrence: Nu vil jeg fejre det med en middag!"](https://www.dr.dk/nyheder/kultur/klassisk/28-aarige-ryan-tager-1-plads-i-stor-dansk-musikkonkurrence-nu-vil-jeg-fejre). *DR* (in Danish). Retrieved 28 April 2018.
13. **[^](#cite_ref-14)** ["Congratulations to the winners of the Malko competition 2021!"](https://malkocompetition.dk/). *Malko Competition*. Retrieved 12 June 2021.

steps.reasoning: The only Malko Competition recipient from the 20th Century after 1977 whose nationality corresponds to a country that no longer exists is Claus Peter Flor, who was from East Germany.

steps.overview: Identified the only Malko Competition recipient from the 20th Century after 1977 whose nationality corresponds to a non-existent country.
